If such has been the practice in the past, I have committed an error for which I apologize, but I have not yet been informed that it has ever been the practice.

speech.para: Motion (by Mr. Lane) put -

quote.para: That the question he now put.

talk.start.para: - Let them have their class Parliament and class justice.
- Order ! The honorable member for East Sydney (Mr. Ward) is distinctly out of order. Honorable members must preserve silence while the division bells are ringing.
- The honorable member for Cook (Mr. Garden) is defying the order of the Chair.
- Is there a movement of the troops?

- Order ! I appoint the honorable member for Robertson and the honorable member for New England tellers for the " Ayes ", and the honorable member for Kalgoorlie and the honorable member for Batman as tellers for the "Noes".
- It is not the practice to call upon ex-Ministers of the Crown to act as tellers. I therefore decline to act.
- Order ! The honorable member need not give his reasons for declining.
- I understood that I was in contempt if I did not explain my position.
- The honorable member need not give his reason. I appoint the honorable member for Kalgoorlie a teller for the " Noes ".
- I decline.
- Then I declare the question resolved in the affirmative.

speech.para: Original question resolved in the affirmative.

l asked the Prime Minister, upon notice -

item.para: In view of the recent increase in the price of petrol by the major oil distributors in Australia, does the Government intend to give effect to the recommendations of the Royal Commission on the Oil Industry ?
Will the House be given the opportunity of resuming the debate on the commission's report?

talk.start.para: - The answers to the honorable member's questions are as follows : -

item.para: As stated in my reply to a question by the honorable member for Melbourne Ports (Mr. Holloway) on the 1st October (Hansard, No. . 10, page 375), the Government's intentions as to the action it proposes to take on the recommendations of the royal commission will be announced at an appropriate time. It would be contrary to the practice to make an announcement on a matter of government policy in answer to a question.
Yes, when the more urgent business requiring the attention of the House is disposed of.

answer.para: Mr.Mulcahy asked the Prime Minister, upon notice -

item.para: Is it the intention of the Government to renew the subsidy to Burns. Philp and Company for the carriage of mails to the islands?

If so, before the renewal, will the Government inquire into the rates charged by the company for passengers and freight, to ascertain whether they are excessive, and also whether the passenger accommodation on the company's steamer should be improved?

talk.start.para: s.- The answers to the honorable member's questions a'ro as follows : -

item.para: The question of the action to be taken to provide fur the maintenance of shipping services' to certain territories and islands in the Pacific after the expiration of the current agreement with Burns, Philp and Company Limited is receiving attention.
All aspects of the service including passage and freight rates and accommodation are being investigated.

talk.start.para: asked the Prime Minister, upon notice - in view of the fact that the dwelling places of Shakespeare, Houen Burlis, arid other great poets of the past have been sacredly preserved for posterity, will the Prime Minister sympathetically consider a nation-wide desire that the Eurunderie home of Henry Lawson, our greatest and most honoured writer, mid a literary link with Australia's pioneer?, will he appropriately preserved ns a. national literary shrine?
s - The suggestion of the honorable member will receive consideration.
y asked the Minister in charge of War Service Homes, upon notice -

quote.para: Kas he instructed his department to cease further prosecutions by garnishee or any other means in the case of cx-soldiers who have surrendered or been dispossessed of their homer. ?

question.para: Mr. THORBY.-No. The commission does not initiate legal proceedings in any case unless all other efforts to induce the purchaser to meet his obligations are unsuccessful.

talk.start.para: l.- -On the. 3rd October, the honorable member for Denison (Mr.- Mahoney) asked, without notice, a question pertaining to the provision of a wireless broadcasting studio at. Hobart. I am now in a position to furnish the honorable member with the following, information : -

quote.para: The Australian Broadcasting Commission advises that it is the intention to build studios at Hobart. The plans are now under review, but details have not yet been finally worked nut.
